messageBody:
>So said Bryce Fischer on 2003-05-14 --------------------
>I've got a fairly basic class (actually, its just a container for other
>classes). This class needs to be serialized to a file and then reloaded at
>some point.
>
>
>
>I'm using this as an opportunity to learn more about JUnit (since its
>fairly
>simple). My question is this
>
>
>
>Given that I have two methods of my class I need to test, SaveLicense and
>LoadLicense, should I write this as two separate tests or as a single test
>that incorporates both? To clarify, to load a license, I would need to have
>a saved license. The load license would then verify that the information
>that was saved was loaded correctly.

Short answer: two tests.

Longer answer: pretend neither were implemented. Try writing the test first. With which test do you start?

By the way, you absolutely do not need a saved licence to test loading a licence -- at least not the way you think. (How?)

Take care.
